comment: A subset of a topology is a basis for the topology iff every member of the topology is a union of members of the basis. We use the idiom " ` ( topGen `` B ) = J ` " to express " ` B ` is a basis for topology ` J ` " since we do not have a separate notation for this. Definition 15.35 of [Schechter] p. 428.
